availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel and Elizabeth Mourning. Married to Marietta Blandford Mourning in Taylor County, Kentucky on October 27, 1851. Faher of William H. Mourning, Elizabeth F. Mourning, James Samuel Mourning, Thomas B. Mourning, and John Mourning. Merchant in Taylor County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville, p. 112.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor, Division 1, p. 178A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Arkansas, Pope, Gally Rock, p. 353B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Taylor County Marriages, Film #000983734.
Find A Grave, "Daniel M. Mourning (1827-1917)," Memorial #39642660, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/39642660 (accessed September 25, 2019).
